target_audience.primary_persona: ADHD adults who struggle with manual journaling/tracking and want voice-first capture with gamification to stay motivated
secondary_personas: Quantified self enthusiasts tracking mood, health, and productivity metrics
Busy professionals who want frictionless life logging
Fitness and health trackers wanting unified workout/nutrition/mood logging
Knowledge workers seeking timeline-based personal analytics
pain_points: Traditional journaling and tracking apps require too much manual data entry
Punitive gamification (like Habitica) causes shame spirals for ADHD users
Data is scattered across multiple apps without unified insights
Voice apps don't understand context or produce structured data
Difficulty correlating mood/energy patterns with activities
goals: Capture life events, tasks, habits, and trackers primarily via voice
Get instant insights from dashboards and views without cleanup
Maintain motivation through non-punitive XP-based gamification
Track time, habits, and workouts with minimal friction
Understand patterns between activities and mood/energy
target_audience.usage_context: Throughout the day on mobile (quick voice captures) and desktop (review, analytics, planning). Users speak their life events and let AI parse into structured data for later analysis.

product_vision.one_liner: The easiest journal to use (voice-first) with the most powerful analytics (structured, queryable life database)
product_vision.problem_statement: Manual data entry kills journaling and tracking habits. People want insights about their life but hate typing entries. Existing apps either require too much effort (Notion, Obsidian) or punish users for missing habits (Habitica), creating shame instead of motivation.
product_vision.value_proposition: Voice-first capture with AI parsing turns 30-second voice notes into structured events, tasks, habits, and trackers. Non-punitive XP gamification rewards without punishment. Local-first architecture ensures data ownership and offline reliability. Unified data model makes everything queryable.
success_metrics: Users can answer 'what did I do yesterday' using views without cleanup
Daily engagement through capture streaks and XP accumulation
Net Promoter Score above 50 in ADHD community

existing_features: Voice capture with Whisper transcription and GPT parsing
Dashboard with daily overview, XP ring, streaks, and active timers
Habits with streaks, quick logging, and timed sessions
Timeline with chronological event feed and filters
Tiimo-style visual day/week calendar with drag-drop
Focus mode with active session timer and XP calculation
Reports with category breakdown and time filtering
Health module with workouts and nutrition tracking
Life Tracker (Nomie-style) with heatmaps and charts
Notes inbox with tag extraction and search
Assistant with local search and LLM fallback
Auth with email and OAuth (Google, Apple, Azure)
XP/gamification system with levels and achievements
known_gaps: No bidirectional sync (data loss risk if device lost)
No onboarding flow (80%+ D1 churn risk)
Habit creation form incomplete on mobile
No conflict resolution in sync layer
technical_debt: No feature flags for safe rollouts
Missing privacy policy and terms of service

alternatives: Habitica (gamified habit tracker with punitive mechanics)
differentiators: AI parsing to structured data (unique in market)
Non-punitive gamification (no HP loss, XP only)
Adaptive learning improves parsing over time
Unified data model (events, tasks, habits, trackers)
competitive_context.market_position: Occupies unique quadrant of high gamification + low friction (voice-first). Positioned as 'the productivity app built for brains that work differently' targeting ADHD community first. TAM approximately $22B across habit tracking, digital journaling, and quantified self markets.

technical: Single-user per account (no collaboration in MVP)
Supabase is canonical source of truth
No client-side LLM keys (all model calls server-side)
iOS requires App Store approval and privacy policy
Offline parsing not supported (capture offline, parse online)
resources: Need to ship monetization within 2 weeks to sustain development
dependencies: Supabase for backend (Postgres, Storage, Edge Functions)
